description: hold +â€Ž out, from the phrasal verb.

entries.meaning: One who refuses to give consent to an agreement in the hope of an improved offer; one who holds out; one who clings to a cause that has been mostly abandoned.
(card games) A device for cheating at card games by covertly holding a card out of play until it is wanted.
examples: He is probably working a vest or sleeve hold-out. Some clumsy or audacious sharpers will go so far as to hold out cards in their lap, or stick them in a "bug" under the table.
